Reduced income inequality: As education becomes more accessible, individuals from lower-income backgrounds would have a greater chance to acquire higher-paying jobs, leading to reduced income inequality.

Improved public health: Education can help individuals make informed decisions about their health, leading to better health outcomes. Additionally, educated individuals are more likely to seek out preventive care and adopt healthy habits.
Increased civic engagement: Education can help individuals understand the importance of civic participation and the role they play in shaping their communities.

Environmental sustainability: Educated individuals are more likely to understand the importance of environmental conservation and sustainable practices, leading to a more environmentally conscious society.
Economic growth: A well-educated workforce is more productive and innovative, leading to economic growth and job creation.
